https://prez.dev/description.@value: The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought
Relates a concept to a concept that is more general in meaning
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
skos:narrowMatch is used to state a hierarchical mapping link between two conceptual resources in different concept schemes
A notation, also known as classification code, is a string of characters such as 'T58.5' or '303.4833' used to uniquely identify a concept within the scope of a given concept scheme
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language

The form of a sample, i.e. the visible shape or configuration of a geological material. The listing includes both primary samples and derived specimens, that is primary sources (e.g. drillcore, hand specimen) and items resulting from preparation of those source materials for the purpose of research/analytical work (e.g. thin section, fine powder). Artefacts are also included, but in this vocabulary they specifically refer to man-made objects of cultural or historical interest such as a tool or decoration (i.e. items such as thin sections, mounts, etc. are not regarded as artefacts in this context). Descriptions were compiled trying to avoid reference to the material that comprises the specimen (e.g. rock, fossil) or the sampling method (e.g. drilling), although in practice it is not always possible to completely separate these concepts from the sample type (e.g. rotary sidewall core); in fact many of the concepts for sample type and sample materials are (incorrectly) used interchangeably.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Separated or isolated microfossil mounted on a backing in preparation for imaging or analysis. This term is preferred when the form of the mount is unknown, and is a partial equivalent of SEM mount / SEM stub where the mounted material is a fossil prepared for SEM microscopy. Gridded slides and well slides are occasionally referred to as mounts or mounted slides but are better considered as slide types.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition compiled by the Geological Survey of Western Australia

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Separated or isolated microfossil mounted on a backing in preparation for imaging or analysis. This term is preferred when the form of the mount is unknown, and is a partial equivalent of SEM mount / SEM stub where the mounted material is a fossil prepared for SEM microscopy. Gridded slides and well slides are occasionally referred to as mounts or mounted slides but are better considered as slide types.
An entry that is seen as having a reasonable measure of stability, may be used to mark the full adoption of a previously 'experimental' entry.
A slide prepared for microscope analysis of microfossils.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
